en.purpose: To assess functional status as a measurement of the elderÂ´s ability to perform activities of daily living independently.
en.use: Use to assess functional status in elderly and calculate a total ADL score.
en.misuse: Do not use to assess other activities than the specified by the ADL scale.

other_details.references: Katz S., Ford AB, Moskowitz RW, et al. Studies of Illness in the Aged. The Index of ADL: A Standardized Measure of Biological and Psychosocial Function. JAMA: 1963; 185(12):914-919.

gt0001.description: The Katz Activity of Daily Living (ADL) scale assesses the level of independency in elderly, based on six items (bathing, dressing, toileting, transferring, continence and feeding). The score for each item ranges from 0 (unable to perform the activity) to 1 (able to perform the activity). The total ADL score ranges from 0 (completely dependent) to 6 (completely independent).
